name: Arthur D. Little
tagline: World's first consulting firm—strategy with deep tech and innovation DNA
description: As people, organizations and societies embrace change at pace, its leaders must anticipate, innovate and transform ever faster. We help our clients overcome today's most pressing challenges and seize tomorrow's most promising opportunities. With a powerful blend of creative thinking and scientific rigor we link people, technology and strategy to find original and pragmatic ways to accelerate performance, innovate through convergence and digital, and make a positive impact on the world.
known_for: Founded in 1886, Arthur D. Little is the world's first management consulting firm and maintains a distinctive heritage linking strategy, technology, and innovation. Known for rigorous scientific thinking combined with creative problem-solving, particularly strong in automotive, energy, and telecommunications sectors.
career_path: Business Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Consultant (2-3 yrs) → Manager (2-3 yrs) → Principal (3-4 yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Application → Phone Screen (behavioral + market sizing) → First Round (2 case + behavioral) → Final Round (2 case + behavioral with senior interviewers)
recruiting.unique: Mix of traditional one-on-one cases and written case presentations. Phone screen includes a full market sizing case that develops from initial questions. Interviewers collaborative and willing to help rather than letting candidates get stuck.
recruiting.timeline: Rolling applications year-round. Average hiring process takes ~26 days from application to offer. Target schools include Brown, Dartmouth, Stanford, and UC Berkeley for U.S. undergrads.

byu.tip: No BYU presence—requires cold networking. Focus on Boston or San Francisco offices for tech-oriented work. Emphasize any innovation, R&D, or technical background in your outreach.
